awd_titl_txt: Nonlinear Ionospheric Plasma Studies at Arecibo
awd_abstract_narration: The Arecibo observatory and the powerful HF source at                      Islote when supplemented by portable HF and ULF receivers                       comprise a major natural laboratory for studying the midlatitude                ionosphere.  This grant is to study the effects observed when the               ionosphere over Arecibo is irradiated with two strong HF signals.               By measuring simultaneously the amplitudes of these waves, the                  contribution of the beat - frequency wave on sideband production                will be assessed.  Further studies will be undertaken which will                examine the propagation characteristics of the launched ULF wave.               The proposed experiments will aid in understanding  the roles of                the relevant nonlinear processes.  *** //
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
